docs.lead_paragraph: As she walks along a dirt road in central Malawi, Louise Abale carries her precious maize wrapped in a brightly colored cloth and balanced on her head.

headline.print_headline: In Southern Africa, an Illusion Built on Aid Heralds Hope and Hunger

docs.lead_paragraph: The frothy, walnut-size blobs attached to shrubs this time of the year belong to mantises, the camouflaged insects who are subject of many urban myths.

headline.main: The Praying Mantis, a Friend and Foe of New York City Gardens

docs.abstract: NYC Nature column on praying mantis, insect whose bubbly walnut-sized egg sacs can be spotted on stalks and posts during winter in New York City.
docs.snippet: The frothy, walnut-size blobs attached to shrubs this time of the year belong to mantises, the camouflaged insects who are subject of many urban myths.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our daughter started life on a feeding tube. Then we tried to wean her off it — and began to understand the complexity of how children relate to food.
docs.abstract: Virginia Sole-Smith describes attempts to wean her baby daughter off of feeding tube after series of surgeries necessitated its use, noting challenges she faced because her child had developed infantile anorexia; reflects that learning to eat, often assumed to be automatic, is learned process requiring constant reinforcement in early stages of life.
docs.snippet: Our daughter started life on a feeding tube. Then we tried to wean her off it — and began to understand the complexity of how children relate to food.

keywords.value: Mott, C S, Children's Hospital (Ann Arbor, Mich)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Michigan lawmakers moved quickly Thursday to start approving $30 million to help pay the water bills of Flint residents facing a lead-contaminated water supply.

headline.main: Michigan Senate OKs $30 Million to Cover Flint Water Bills
headline.print_headline: Michigan Senate OKs $30 Million to Cover Flint Water Bills

docs.lead_paragraph: War-weary Ukraine is struggling to recruit soldiers to fight pro-Russian separatists in the east, with enthusiasm sapped by reports of ill-equipped troops and poor treatment of families of missing soldiers.

headline.main: Ukraine Struggles to Recruit Soldiers for War in East
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Struggles to Recruit Soldiers for War in East

headline.main: Sleep Problems Tied to Type 2 Diabetes

docs.abstract: Trouble falling or staying asleep, sleeping less than six hours a night, snoring, apnea and shift work were linked to an increased risk of diabetes in women.
docs.snippet: Trouble falling or staying asleep, sleeping less than six hours a night, snoring, apnea and shift work were linked to an increased risk of diabetes in women.

docs.lead_paragraph: Soup cleanses promise an easier detox than a juice cleanse.

headline.print_headline: For Some, Soup Is the New Juice

docs.abstract: Soup-based cleanses are becoming popular among those who find juice cleanses too extreme.
docs.snippet: Soup cleanses promise an easier detox than a juice cleanse.

headline.main: A Diet and Exercise Plan to Lose Weight and Gain Muscle

docs.abstract: A high-intensity, high-protein workout and food plan helped men drop 11 to 12 pounds in a month while adding three pounds of muscle mass.
docs.snippet: A high-intensity, high-protein workout and food plan helped men drop 11 to 12 pounds in a month while adding three pounds of muscle mass.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tens of thousands of trapped Iraqi civilians are running out of food and medicine in the western city of Falluja, an Islamic State stronghold under siege by security forces, according to local officials and residents.
